headline: TikTok signs deal to form new US unit with investors, including Oracle, Silver Lake
summary: TikTok has signed agreements with three major investors — Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX — to form a new TikTok U.S. joint venture, ensuring the popular social video platform can continue operating in the United States.  The deal is expected to close on Jan. 22, according to an internal memo seen by The Associated Press.  In the communication, CEO Shou Zi Chew confirmed to employees that ByteDance and TikTok signed the binding agreements with the consortium.

content.title: TikTok signs deal to form new US unit with investors, including Oracle, Silver Lake
content.summary: TikTok has signed agreements with three major investors — Oracle, Silver Lake and MGX — to form a new TikTok U.S. joint venture, ensuring the popular social video platform can continue operating in the United States.  The deal is expected to close on Jan. 22, according to an internal memo seen by The Associated Press.  In the communication, CEO Shou Zi Chew confirmed to employees that ByteDance and TikTok signed the binding agreements with the consortium.

headline: China's ByteDance agrees deal to hand control of TikTok US app to new joint venture
summary: TikTok's Chinese owner, ByteDance, on Thursday signed binding agreements to hand control of the short video app's U.S. operations to a group of investors, including Oracle, in a big step toward avoiding a U.S. ban and ending years of uncertainty.  The deal is a milestone for the short video app used regularly by more than 170 ​million Americans after years of battles that began in August 2020, when President Donald Trump first tried unsuccessfully to ban the app over U.S. national security concerns.  Financial terms of the deal, announced in ‌an internal memo by TikTok (U.S.) seen by Reuters, were not disclosed.

content.title: China's ByteDance agrees deal to hand control of TikTok US app to new joint venture
content.summary: TikTok's Chinese owner, ByteDance, on Thursday signed binding agreements to hand control of the short video app's U.S. operations to a group of investors, including Oracle, in a big step toward avoiding a U.S. ban and ending years of uncertainty.  The deal is a milestone for the short video app used regularly by more than 170 ​million Americans after years of battles that began in August 2020, when President Donald Trump first tried unsuccessfully to ban the app over U.S. national security concerns.  Financial terms of the deal, announced in ‌an internal memo by TikTok (U.S.) seen by Reuters, were not disclosed.

thumbnail.caption: Illustration shows U.S. flag and TikTok logo

headline: Oracle and OpenAI Win Michigan Approval to Power New Data Center
summary: DTE had asked regulators for expedited approval of its plan to power the multi-billion dollar, 1.4-gigawatt facility in Saline Township.  “They show a net financial benefit to DTE’s other customers,” said Dan Scripps, chair of the Michigan Public Service Commission.  The rapid build-out of data centers in the US has transformed the energy industry, with growing controversy over facilities that can suck up as much electricity as entire cities.

content.title: Oracle and OpenAI Win Michigan Approval to Power New Data Center
content.summary: DTE had asked regulators for expedited approval of its plan to power the multi-billion dollar, 1.4-gigawatt facility in Saline Township.  “They show a net financial benefit to DTE’s other customers,” said Dan Scripps, chair of the Michigan Public Service Commission.  The rapid build-out of data centers in the US has transformed the energy industry, with growing controversy over facilities that can suck up as much electricity as entire cities.

headline: Data Center Capex Up 59 Percent on Continued AI Investment in 3Q 2025, According to Dell'Oro Group
summary: According to a recently published report by Dell'Oro Group, the trusted source for market information about the telecommunications, security, networks, and data center industries, worldwide data center capital expenditures increased 59 percent year-over-year, marking the eighth consecutive quarter of double-digit growth as the AI investment cycle continues to broaden beyond early, training-focused deployments.

headline: U.S. Tech Stocks Rebound Premarket After Heavy Selloff

headline: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

content.title: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
content.summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

headline: What it takes to construct an AI data center, Hut 8 CEO outlines
summary: Hut 8 Corp. (HUT) unveiled its own partnership with Anthropic (ANTH.PVT) and Fluidstack to build an AI data center in Louisiana. Alphabet's Google (GOOG, GOOGL) is providing the backstop on this latter deal. Hut 8 CEO Asher Genoot joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi to further discuss the logistics behind constructing the data center, designing the systems inside the facility, and Google's credit history that ultimately enabled this deal. Also watch Asher Genoot explain some of the details of the data center deal and Google's invaluable role in securing it. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Why Oracle is this analyst's top 2026 software stock pick
